wexpman.gatewayobjects.impl.condor

Class CondorSystemGateway

  • java.lang.Object
    • wexpman.gatewayobjects.impl.condor.CondorSystemGateway
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NativeSystemGateway

    public class CondorSystemGateway
extends Object
implements NativeSystemGateway
    Provides a Gateway to a Condor submission system
    Author:
    Matias Alberto Gavinowich

      Submits the given job to the (external) job submission system May modify the given job to store information about the execution on the remote system
      boolean supportsBatchedRemoval()
      Checks whether the gateway supports the removal of a whole batch of jobs at once, if so a native job instance which actually represents a batch of jobs would be used when performing the removal
      boolean supportsBatchedSubmission()
      Checks whether the gateway supports the submission of several native jobs at once as a batch

      • CondorSystemGateway

        public CondorSystemGateway(String scheddUrl)
                    throws GatewayInitializationException
        Constructs the Condor System Gateway with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        scheddUrl - a String with the URL of the submission node schedd
        Throws:
        GatewayInitializationException - if the gateway cannot be constructed

    • Method Detail

      • getJobOutput

        public List<File> getJobOutput(NativeJob job,
                      File holderDirectory,
                      boolean deleteRemoteCopy)
                        throws JobNotCompletedException,
                               JobQueryException,
                               JobDataRetrievalException
        Description copied from interface: NativeSystemGateway
        Gets the output files produced by the given job
        Specified by:
        getJobOutput in interface NativeSystemGateway
        Parameters:
        job - the NativeJob which output is being requested
        holderDirectory - a File pointing to a directory relative to which the gateway will save the output files
        deleteRemoteCopy - a boolean value indicating if associated remote resources can be freed, if true this method cannot be invoked again on the same job
        Returns:
        a List of output File
        Throws:
        JobNotCompletedException - if this method is invoked before the job has completed execution
        JobQueryException - if there is a problem querying job information
        JobDataRetrievalException - if the job output cannot be retrieved
        See Also:
        NativeSystemGateway.getJobOutput(wexpman.gatewayobjects.NativeJob, java.io.File, boolean)

        Description copied from interface: NativeSystemGateway

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        job - the NativeJob which status is being queried
        Returns:
        the status of the job as a String
        Throws:
        JobQueryException - if the query for the job status was unsuccessful
        See Also:

      • getNewJob

        public NativeJob getNewJob(String friendlyName,
                  String owner,
                  String jobType,
                  String executable,
                  String arguments,
                  List<File> files,
                  List<String> extraRemoteFiles)
        Description copied from interface: NativeSystemGateway
        Constructs a job for submission - but does not submit it
        Specified by:
        getNewJob in interface NativeSystemGateway
        Parameters:
        friendlyName - a (String) friendly name for the job
        owner - a (String) name of the owner of the job
        jobType - an indication of the jobType, as a String, possible values for this parameter depend on the concrete implementation and could be e.g. 'vanilla' or 'standard' for a Condor system, or 'single', 'multiple', 'condor', 'mpi' in a Globus system
        executable - the (String) path to the executable in the remote system
        arguments - the (String) arguments to pass to the executable
        files - a List of File to be transferred to the remote system and used as inputs for the job
        extraRemoteFiles - a List of String with the paths of files that exist on the remote system and that should be considered as extra inputs for the job
        Returns:
        the NativeJob ready for submission
        See Also:
        wexpman.gatewayobjects.NativeSystemGateway#getNewJob(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.util.List)

      • removeJob

        public void removeJob(NativeJob job)
               throws JobCommandException,
                      UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from interface: NativeSystemGateway
        Removes the job from the remote system, canceling its execution
        Specified by:
        removeJob in interface NativeSystemGateway
        Parameters:
        job - the NativeJob to remove, can represent a whole batch of jobs if batched removal is supported by the concrete implementation
        Throws:
        JobCommandException - if the job cannot be removed
        UnsupportedOperationException - if job represents a batch and batched removal is not supported
        See Also:
        NativeSystemGateway.removeJob(wexpman.gatewayobjects.NativeJob)

      • submitBatchOfJobs

        public NativeJob submitBatchOfJobs(List<NativeJob> jobs)
                            throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                                   JobSubmissionException
        Description copied from interface: NativeSystemGateway
        Submits all the given jobs as part of the same batch May modify the given jobs to store information about the execution on the remote system
        Specified by:
        submitBatchOfJobs in interface NativeSystemGateway
        Parameters:
        jobs - a List of NativeJob to submit
        Returns:
        a NativeJob that represents the batch of submitted jobs
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if batch submission is not supported by the implementation
        JobSubmissionException - if any of the given jobs could not be submitted
        See Also:
        NativeSystemGateway.submitBatchOfJobs(java.util.List)

      • supportsBatchedRemoval

        public boolean supportsBatchedRemoval()
        Description copied from interface: NativeSystemGateway
        Checks whether the gateway supports the removal of a whole batch of jobs at once, if so a native job instance which actually represents a batch of jobs would be used when performing the removal
        Specified by:
        supportsBatchedRemoval in interface NativeSystemGateway
        Returns:
        true if the gateway supports batched removal
        See Also:
        NativeSystemGateway.supportsBatchedRemoval()

      • isPresentInRemoteSystem

        public boolean isPresentInRemoteSystem(NativeJob job)
                                throws JobQueryException
        Description copied from interface: NativeSystemGateway
        Asks if the given job is present in the remote submission system (i.e has been submitted and nobody has removed it)
        Specified by:
        isPresentInRemoteSystem in interface NativeSystemGateway
        Parameters:
        job - the NativeJob to seek in the remote system
        Returns:
        true if the job is in the remote system, false otherwise
        Throws:
        JobQueryException - if the remote system could not be queried for the job
        See Also:
        NativeSystemGateway.isPresentInRemoteSystem(wexpman.gatewayobjects.NativeJob)
